Container.Name: AnonAddy
Container.Category: Cloud: Network:Privacy Productivity: Tools: Other: Status:Stable
Container.ExtraSearchTerms: email bitwarden anonymous redirect forward hide
Container.Requires: Requires a separate MySQL and Redis server. See documentation: https://github.com/anonaddy/anonaddy/blob/master/SELF-HOSTING.md

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: SMTP Email Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 25

Config.Name: App URL
Config.Description: The URL to the AnonAddy server

Config.Name: MySQL - Host
Config.Description: The host for the MySQL database connection

Config.Name: MySQL - Port
Config.Description: The port for the MySQL database connection

Config.Name: MySQL - Username
Config.Description: The username for the MySQL database connection

Config.Name: MySQL - Password
Config.Description: The password for the MySQL database connection

Config.Name: MySQL - Database
Config.Description: The name of the MySQL database

Config.Name: Redis - Host
Config.Description: The host for the Redis connection

Config.Name: Redis - Port
Config.Description: The port for the Redis connection

Config.Name: Redis - Password
Config.Description: The password for the Redis connection. Use 'null' to not set.

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - From Name
Config.Description: The name to use when sending emails

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - From Address
Config.Description: The email address to use when sending emails

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - Host
Config.Description: The host for the mail server connection

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - Port
Config.Description: The port for the mail server connection. Not recommended to change.

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - Encryption
Config.Description: The encryption for the mail server connection

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - EHLO Host
Config.Description: The EHLO host for the mail server connection

Config.Name: Outgoing Mail - Verify Peer
Config.Description: Verify the peer when connecting to the mail server

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Return Email
Config.Description: The SMTP FROM address to be used if the alias address cannot be, e.g. for a custom domain that is not verified for sending

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Admin Username
Config.Description: The username for the admin account

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Enable Registration
Config.Description: Allow users to register

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Domain
Config.Description: The domain to use for the AnonAddy server

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Hostname
Config.Description: The hostname to use for the AnonAddy server

Config.Name: AnonAddy - DNS Resolver
Config.Description: The DNS resolver to use for the AnonAddy server

Config.Name: AnonAddy - All Domains
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of all domains to use for the AnonAddy server

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Secret
Config.Description: The secret to use for the AnonAddy server. Run `openssl rand -base64 32` to generate.

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Email Limit
Config.Description: Number of emails that can be forwarded through the service per hour by any one user

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Bandwidth Limit
Config.Description: Monthly bandwidth limit, in bytes

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Alias Limit
Config.Description: Number of new aliases that can be created per hour

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Additional Username Limit
Config.Description: Number of additional usernames that can be added

Config.Name: AnonAddy - Private Key Fingerprint
Config.Description: Fingerprint of the private key that you generated on the server to be used to sign encrypted forwarded emails

Config.Name: App Name
Config.Description: The name of the app

Config.Name: App Environment
Config.Description: The environment the app is running in

Config.Name: Enable Debugging
Config.Description: Enable debugging

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: The log level
